items.sentence: I still don\'t understand what you\'re talking about.
I just don\'t want to have people thinking I\'m weak.
Right now, all I want to do is sleep for a few hours.
Sales have dropped off at every big department store.
She advised him not to borrow money from his friends.
Yesterday, Mary cleaned the house and washed clothes.
This is the most comfortable chair I\'ve ever sat in.
Tom is the one who told me when the meeting would be.
Tom leaned forward and gave Mary a kiss on the cheek.
Tom picked up the bottle, but had trouble opening it.
Tom plays the cello with one of the local orchestras.
A book without preface is like a body without a soul.
Do you think we\'ll have a white Christmas this year?
Don\'t look out the window. Concentrate on your work.
I bet Tom would be glad if Mary didn\'t come tonight.
Tom and I don\'t sing together as much as we used to.
Tom doesn\'t need to go there if he doesn\'t want to.
I thought you said you didn\'t know anyone in Boston.
Tom decided to give up playing guitar professionally.
We walked through the mall, looking for a shoe store.
Were you the one who advised Tom to go to the police?
What do you think is the most popular sport in Japan?
What makes you think we should buy something for Tom?
When Tom stopped for a stop sign, his engine stalled.
Have you visited the town where your father was born?
He finally realized that Mary had made a fool of him.
He gave me an orange in exchange for a piece of cake.
They were very tired, hungry, and thirsty that night.
To tell the truth, I forgot all about your questions.
Tom and Mary tried to keep their relationship secret.
He\'s been staying at that hotel since five days ago.
How has your life been different than your father\'s?
You do know who Tom\'s French teacher is, don\'t you?
You don\'t have to do anything you don\'t want to do.
I don\'t have enough money to pay this month\'s rent.
I don\'t know if I\'ll be able to help you on Monday.
I don\'t know whether he\'ll come by train or by car.
Tom said that he didn\'t want to go to Mary\'s party.
Tom left for Boston as soon as he got Mary\'s letter.
Once you\'ve said something, it can\'t be taken back.
Please don\'t talk to the driver while he\'s driving.
Tom told Mary that her French was easy to understand.
Tom told everybody at school about what had happened.
Tom told himself that he had made the right decision.
I can\'t understand why she doesn\'t love me anymore.
My father finally learned to drive when he was fifty.
My mother has been learning French for several years.
You know that Tom used to live in Boston, don\'t you?
They wanted me to sell drugs for them, but I refused.
This camera is the one that Tom bought last Thursday.
